thread.title: Toddler, 11-year-old are latest victims of Chicago's gun violence
thread.title_full: Toddler, 11-year-old are latest victims of Chicago's gun violence

author: CHRISTOPHER BRENNAN
title: Toddler, 11-year-old are latest victims of Chicago's gun violence
text:
NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Updated:   6:25 PM 
A two-year-old boy and an 11-year-old girl are among the latest innocent victims in Chicago’s gun violence epidemic. 
An unidentified toddler was shot along with his 20-year-old aunt and her 25-year-old boyfriend Tuesday afternoon while driving in an alley on the city’s South Side, according to police. 
The 25-year-old, a documented gang member believed to be targeted in the shooting, was also pronounced dead after being hit in the head when a gunman popped out of another car and opened fire. 
The aunt, who was pregnant and shot in the stomach, was in fair condition early Tuesday evening. 
“This has got to stop somewhere. Our children should not have to pay the price for our inability to hold repeat gun offenders responsible for their actions,” said Chicago Police Superintendent Eddie Johnson, who lambasted “legislative partners” for their inaction. A 2-year-old boy was shot and killed on Chicago's South Side Tuesday afternoon. (WGNtv) 
Johnson said that his department had "promising leads" in finding the shooter and two others traveling with him. 
The shooting came the same day an 11-year-old girl struck in the head by a stray bullet while sitting in a minivan died. 
Takiya Holmes had been on life support at a local hospital after she was shot Saturday night, also on the city’s South Side. 
“At 8:17 this morning Takiya passed away in her mother's arms,” her cousin Rachel Rae Williams posted on Facebook. Takiya Holmes, 11, died Tuesday after being struck by a stray bullet. (Handout) 
Police say that Takiya was in the back passenger’s seat of a car when a gunman fired an unidentified number of shots intended for someone else. 
A page setting up a vigil for the little girl said that her family had been loading groceries when the gunfire erupted. 
There have been 92 children 11 or younger who have been killed in Chicago’s gun violence epidemic, according to the Chicago Tribune . 
The fifth grader’s grandmother Patsy Holmes told the newspaper that her granddaughter was “jovial” and had “eyes and dimples that will set your heart on fire.” 
Kanari Bowers, 12, was wounded by a stray bullet in a separate incident Saturday night, and remained hospitalized in critical condition Tuesday. Join the Conversation:
